reviews.text: Very interesting museum. I was impressed by the exposition
So disappointed how this once wonderful archive of Settler history has been neglected and is now hardly worth visiting. Rest rooms are out of order and the exhibits are uninspiring to say the least.

Very interesting and educational local history section. There is a small entry fee. Half of the main floor is dedicated to the 1820 settlers from Britain and how they lived their lives and their culture in the decades after their arrival and settlement in the Albany district. The other half of the main floor is about the local history and culture of the indigenous peoples of the Eastern Cape. The curator and geneologist are also very helpful to researchers who have special interests and may want to consult the archival collection, by appointment.
Good compilation and informative
What kind of museum is closed on a Saturday especially in peak season
Má administração do poder público. Patrimônio histórico, sem seu devido valor por mídias, pelo  governo, total falta de respeito, valorização.
variedade muito grande pra conhecer bastante oisa
Bom para ter lazer
Local de fácil acesso e um clima de paz
.Muito  bom  pra saber istorias de bauru um ótimo lazer

Such an amazing place. To remember the struggle! Our fore fathers braved the elements and the environment to establish an economy that we can be proud of! 
Thank you for the wonderful exhibition! And for reminding us that we are not an island. We are all part of something so much bigger than our own prejudices!

One of the best and most humbling things to do when visiting a new place is being able to view that place from a higher vantage point and enjoy the full sprawl of a city or town. The Settlers Monument is the best place to do that in Grahamstown. I travelled to Grahamstown for the 2015 National Arts Festival, and despite all the exciting events happening throughout the town, the Settlers Monument and the view from the hill was still my favourite thing about the trip.
It was my first  time visiting, great quiet place and it's interesting
Sci Fest Africa is 2019 what a great experience, well organized event for all ages a must see if your a teacher or interested in the science.
The building is nice and we had our team building there at night. #Team_Lee @Team_lee
It's wonderful and well kept. I will definitely visit again
A brilliant and illuminating exhibition of South African literary history. The comprehensive archive is managed by experienced librarians and gives researchers access to incredible resources.
Innovative building design, fascinating exhibitions and state of the art facilities.
Really interesting museum, was attending for a book launch. I plan to visit again and check out the exhibitions another time. Worth visiting.
This is the most beautiful place I've ever seen in Grahamstown

This place is great! Most of the exhibits have explanation in English as well as Slovak.
The woolly mammoth is the top!
Never thought I would see such a thing...I also need to mention a bison and a giraffe...
Proper cool...
Been there only once at the Tibet Himalaya exhibition and I liked it. A pleasant surprise.

The museum exhibits a vast range of specimens from various segments of natural history, mainly focused on presentation of the diversity of living and non-living nature in Slovakia. The museum also hosts a variety of temporary exhibitions (check the program on official website).

The museum had interesting exhibits but they could have been better organized and presented. Many tags were written only in Slovak and that made it difficult to follow the exhibitions. You should totally visit if you have a lot of time but i would prefer something else if on a tight schedule

Really interesting museum for all nature lovers. Some taxidermy pieces were really done well, and I love the backgrounds which were made like their real habitat. Whole exhibition is a chronological story from the begining of the life on planet Earth to life we know today. I have so much photos which I could share, but it is best for you to go there and experience it yourself. :)
Great place wonderful guide Very interesting
Fictional tale on stars. Come now show a video on real science.

A must see if you are visiting Grahamstown. The camera obscura is an eapecially
Fascinating experience!
The place is in need of some general up-keeping. Valuable little treasure that’s hardly noticed in this town.
Great place to take kids. Especially enjoyed the dinosaur & fossils exhibit.

Great historic place turned coffee shop. Grab something to drink, from smoothies to tea or a range of coffees. Snacks include customisable panini's, quiches and the wonderful "get-there-early-before-they-gone" croissants. Mostly done fresh on the premises. Former cells have been turned into secluded rooms that make good meeting places. One downside for me is the smoking-culture.
Good place to go for coffee and a snack.  They have a simple food menu for a sandwich, smoothly, or snack.  The little rooms are a bonus if you'd like to huddle with friends.
Former prison turned into a coffee shop. Really good stop after a morning walk the swings are relaxing make a stop when you in the area.

I am not sure why this is still referred to as a museum? The Old Provost, which during settler days served as a military prison, is a quaint and cool coffee shop.    This coffee shop has no waiters but the mere experience of ordering a cuppa and seeing and smelling the process of making the cup, whilst chatting with a friendly barista,  is in itself a soothing experience.    One has the choice of either sitting around tables in the court yard, a cool room upstairs or in the tiny cubicles which were once the cells housing the military convicts.
It's fun and child friendly
Best lodge i have stayed in, in a long time

Truly a luxurious experience from the welcome to the accommodations to the food to the guide and tracker to the lodge staff.  It's hard to imagine a better safari experience, and we found it better than the safari lodge we visited in Kruger. Since it is private and access is limited to the Kwandwe safari vehicles you don't have to compete with day trippers as in Kruger or stay on the roads.  And the vegetation allows access to many more off road areas so you can get a close look at many of the animals.

The most perfect high end safari experience imaginable. From the brilliant and personable tour guides to the manager of kwandwe who reminded me of the character Ricardo montalban played on fantasy island to the unbelievable scenery, I could not recommend kwandwe more highly. Go.
Great safari.  Zebra herd, giraffe herd, rhinos all in the first drive.  Great food & wine. Lovely set up.

We had never done a safari holiday before, but our experience at Kwandwe blew us away.

The level of service, the quality of the safaris, the beauty of the reserve and the exceptional rooms made it such an unforgettable experience that I would recommend it to anyone.

The price tag is high, but everything is included: food, beverages (included wine), safari drives, even laundry.

We stayed at the Great Fish River Lodge, which is without doubt the best option for couples/adults with no children.

A little piece of heaven
Wonderful people 
Wonderful memories..
Best place I've been to in my life
Awesome vibe well worth the visit 🤘👌
Absolutely great private game reserve. My wife and I visited it for the second time and will come again.

Breathtaking scenery, well stocked game reserve, with big five. Nick is an excellent game Ranger and guide with loads of knowledge. Accommodation is 5 star, attention to detail is outstanding. Staff are extremely hospitable, and go out of their way.

We started at Treetops Lodge, and everything was simply superb: the staff, the food,  the facilities, etc. Of course, the game drives were amazing, and we sighted everything except for a leopard.

Highly recommend a stay at Treetop Lodge, where you get visited by Nyalas and even elephants within the camp! However, rather plan your stay for spring/summer, as it gets very cold there in autumn.

Although I rate it as Excellent, there is room for improvement regarding their wine selection.

Thank you to Renee, Righardt, Dumisani, and the rest of the staff for making our stay a truly unforgettable one!

Peter is the best ranger one can dream off!  Knowledgeable, funny, competent and  kind, he gave us a fabulous time during our stay at treetop. We miss you Peter! 
The rooms are nice and klean, the food delicious and the staff friendly. Dreaming of coming back!

Amazing experience at our first game reserve trip being there for 3 nights you get to see almost all the Big 5. The Leopard remained elusive on our trip. Loved every single minute of it. Definitely 5 star treatment the staff couldn't do enough for you the food outstanding. We will be back for another safari we have the bug now.
Beautiful lodge, great staff and informative and good safaris.  Food very average and let the experience down.

This is a very upmarket privat game reserve. The lodges are beautifully appointed and the staff is eager to make the stay a pleasant experience.  The attention to detail is great, compared to other places in this segment.  The Game is plentiful and free roaming. They do a lot of alien tree clearing, so parts of the reserve look more like a farm than a wilderness,  but its all for the right reasons and only temporarily.
Beautiful area and well kept camping grounds. However no hot water or electricity available as advertised.
It was fine just fine
Lovely and very inexpensive way to the enjoy the natural beauty of the Eastern Cape's fauna and flora.
It is a great remote place outside of the busy Grahamstown where you can go unwind with family and friends, whilst enjoying the beautiful scenery and nature.
Great place to have outing with friends and family

I've stayed at this guesthouse back in August 2014 for 4 nights and I had a wonderful experience. The room I was given was not big but was so cosy and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the advantage of this guesthouse is the fact that there was a restaurant on the ground floor that made delicious dishes. I higly recommend it for couples. The only drawback was the fact that my room was on the first floor and there is no elevator in case you have a big luggage or some knee issues like I do. In this case I suggest asking for a ground floor room. I highly recommend it.
